about_the_game:
An FPS starring your favorite platformer character Captain Moviestar… now in full three-dimensions. Early 90’s 2.5D-style raycaster-shooter inspired (Wolfenstein 3D, Chub Gam 3D, Doom, Nite-mare 3D, Ken’s Labyrinth, Rise Of The Triad), y-shearing, jumping, flood-fill sound propagation, 10 weapons, four difficulty modes and 5 episodes of moderately violent action.





Pound your keyboard, gamepad or joystick, scrub your 1-button mouse or trackpad and fight your way through hoards of evil demons, henchmen and monsters. Non-normalized movement vectors so you can strafe-run to speedrun success. Auto-aim so you can play with just arrow-keys, single-stick or d-pad. Localized translations for thirteen languages, so no matter where you are, you can understand what’s going on (or just shoot stuff).





Module-based music, authentic 8-bit sound fx and 15fps particle effects to harass your ears and boggle your mind. 90-degree walls, slopes, environment contrast, reflective mirrors, underwater swimming and hazardous areas all in incredible, eye-popping 6-bit color.







Ten weapons (discluding melee), twenty monsters types, five challenging difficulties and much more planned.

name: Captain Moviestar 3D

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS *: Windows 7
  • Processor: Dual-core
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Support for OpenGL 3.3
  • Storage: 500 MB available space
  • Sound Card: Yes
  • VR Support: No

reviews:
“It’s not that Captain Moviestar 3D is bad, it’s that it reminds me so much of a bad game that I can’t make sane judgement fairly (or convincingly)”
Rick Crobbert's Naffshoot
short_description: An FPS starring your favorite platformer character Captain Moviestar… now in full three-dimensions. Early 90’s 2.5D-raycaster-style shooter for the proto-boomer set.
